channel.title: Borsato on ZooBerry
channel.description: Recent content in Borsato on ZooBerry

item.title: Northern Raccoon
item.description: Adds the common raccoon to your zoo, a highly adaptable and intelligent mammal known for its dexterous paws and nocturnal habits.

item.title: Patagonian Mara
item.description: The Patagonian Mara is a large, rodent-like mammal native to the open grasslands and shrublands of Argentina.

item.title: Perentie
item.description: The perentie is a large monitor lizard native to arid regions of Australia, known for its speed, power, and adaptability.

item.title: Platypus
item.description: The platypus is a unique monotreme native to Australia, famous for its duck-bill, webbed feet, and egg-laying abilities.

item.title: Quokka
item.description: The Quokka is a small marsupial native to Rottnest Island and other parts of Australia, known for its friendly demeanor and frequent photogenic smiles.

item.title: Red River Hog
item.description: The Red River Hog is a striking, colorful member of the pig family, native to the forests and savannas of Central and West Africa.

item.title: Shetland Pony
item.description: The Shetland Pony is a small, hardy breed of pony native to the Shetland Islands, well-suited for cold climates.

item.title: South Island Giant Moa
item.description: The South Island Giant Moa was a massive flightless bird endemic to New Zealand, known for its towering height and ecological significance.

item.title: Southern Rockhopper Penguin
item.description: The Southern Rockhopper Penguin is a small, crested penguin known for its distinctive hopping movements and vibrant yellow crest feathers.

item.title: Stokesosaurus
item.description: Stokesosaurus is a small, agile theropod dinosaur from the Late Jurassic period.

item.title: Blue Marlin
item.description: The Blue Marlin is a fast and powerful fish, symbolizing strength and endurance in the ocean.

item.title: Cape Barren Goose
item.description: The Cape Barren Goose is a large, flightless bird native to southern Australia and Tasmania.

item.title: Capybara
item.description: The Capybara is the world’s largest rodent, known for its semi-aquatic lifestyle and social nature.

item.title: Chiru
item.description: The Chiru, also known as the Tibetan antelope, is a rare and graceful species native to the high plains of Tibet.

item.title: Chital
item.description: The Chital, also known as the spotted deer, is a graceful and agile herbivore found in the forests of India and Sri Lanka.

item.title: Common Wombat
item.description: The Common Wombat is a burrowing marsupial native to the forests and grasslands of southeastern Australia.

item.title: Defassa Waterbucks
item.description: The Defassa Waterbuck is a large, water-loving antelope native to sub-Saharan Africa.

item.title: Emu
item.description: The Emu is the largest bird native to Australia, known for its impressive speed and endurance.

item.title: European Mouflon
item.description: The European Mouflon is a wild sheep native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia.

item.title: Fennec Fox
item.description: The Fennec Fox is a small desert-dwelling fox known for its large ears and playful nature.

item.title: Gelada Baboon
item.description: The Gelada Baboon is a unique primate from the highlands of Ethiopia, known for its heart-shaped chest patch and complex social behaviors.

item.title: Hoatzin
item.description: The Hoatzin is a prehistoric-looking bird with striking plumage, known for its unique digestive system.

item.title: Inca Tern
item.description: The Inca Tern is a striking seabird with a unique red beak and white mustache.

item.title: Kakapo
item.description: The Kakapo is a nocturnal, flightless parrot native to New Zealand, known for its sweet scent and booming calls.

item.title: Koala
item.description: The Koala is a eucalyptus-loving marsupial, native to the forests of Australia.

item.title: Marsh Harrier
item.description: The Marsh Harrier is a bird of prey found in wetlands and marshes across Europe and Asia.

item.title: Nilgai
item.description: The Nilgai, also known as the Blue Bull, is the largest Asian antelope.

item.title: North Sulawesi Babirusa
item.description: The North Sulawesi Babirusa is a fascinating wild pig known for its unique upward-curving tusks.

item.title: Short-Beaked Echidna
item.description: The Short-Beaked Echidna is a spiny monotreme found in Australia and New Guinea.

item.title: Short-Finned Pilot Whale
item.description: The Short-Finned Pilot Whale is a highly social cetacean found in tropical and subtropical oceans worldwide.

item.title: Siberian Musk Deer
item.description: The Siberian Musk Deer is a small, shy deer known for its long fangs and valuable musk.

item.title: South American Coati
item.description: The South American Coati is a highly adaptable and social animal found in forests and grasslands.

item.title: Superb Lyrebird
item.description: The Superb Lyrebird is known for its extraordinary ability to mimic a wide variety of sounds.

item.title: Takahe
item.description: The Takahe is a rare flightless bird native to the South Island of New Zealand.

item.title: Vicuña
item.description: The Vicuña is a graceful Andean ungulate prized for its fine wool.

item.title: Wolverine
item.description: The Wolverine is a fierce and powerful predator found in the forests and tundras of the Northern Hemisphere.

item.title: LANG-ZBorsato.dll
item.description: A language file for Zoo Tycoon 1 that adds new text strings to the game. This file is required for some mods to work properly.

item.title: ui99
item.description: Adds new location graphics and configurations to Zoo Tycoon 1.
